statement.tex: \text{Find the integral of the function}\\ \dfrac{1}{\sin x\cos^3 x} \,

step.context: \text{Are the following calculations and analysis correct?}
step.reason: \text{Applied the trigonometry identity, }\\ \sin^2 x + \cos^2 x = 1 \text{. Check your} \\ \text{ calculations, if you got something else.}

step.context: \text{Is the following evaluation of the integral}\\ \int \left( \tan x \sec^2 x \, + \dfrac{\sec^2 x }{\tan x}\right) dx \quad \text{correct}?
step.tex: \text{Let } \tan x = t \implies \sec^2 x \, dx = dt \\ \int \left( \tan x \sec^2 x \, + \dfrac{\sec^2 x }{\tan x}\right) dx \\ \qquad \qquad \quad \quad = \int \tan x \sec^2 x \, dx + \int \dfrac{\sec^2 x }{\tan x} \, dx \\ \qquad \qquad \quad \quad = \int t \, dt + \int \dfrac{1}{t}dt \\ \qquad \qquad \quad \quad = \dfrac{t^2}{2} + \log |t| + C \\ \therefore \int \dfrac{1}{\sin x\cos^3 x} \, dx = \dfrac{1}{2}\tan^2 x +\log |\tan x| +C

\text{Let } \tan x = t \implies \sec^2 x \, dx = dt \\ \int \left( \tan x \sec^2 x \, + \dfrac{\sec^2 x }{\tan x}\right) dx \\ \qquad \qquad \quad \quad = \int \tan x \sec^2 x \, dx + \int \dfrac{\sec^2 x }{\tan x} \, dx \\ \qquad \qquad \quad \quad = \int t \, dt + \int \dfrac{1}{t}dt \\ \qquad \qquad \quad \quad = \dfrac{t^2}{2} + \log |\dfrac{1}{t}| + C \\ \therefore \int \dfrac{1}{\sin x\cos^3 x} \, dx = \dfrac{1}{2}\tan^2 x +\log |\dfrac{1}{\tan x}| +C
